net.demilich.metastone.game.cards.costmodifier

Class CardCostModifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.demilich.metastone.game.logic.CustomCloneable
      • net.demilich.metastone.game.cards.costmodifier.CardCostModifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, HasDesc<CardCostModifierDesc>, Trigger
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OneTurnCostModifier, ToggleCostModifier

    public class CardCostModifier
extends CustomCloneable
implements Trigger, java.io.Serializable, HasDesc<CardCostModifierDesc>
    A card cost modifier.

    In this example, the specified modifier reduces the hosting entity's cost by one. 

         {
         "class": "CardCostModifier",
         "target": "SELF",
         "operation": "SUBTRACT",
         "value": 1
     }
    See Also:
    for a spell that can put {@link CardCostModifier} effects into play., for a list of arguments for card cost modification., Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • appliesTo

        public boolean appliesTo(GameContext context,
                         Card card,
                         Player player)
        Determines whether this modifier applies to the specified card.

        First, the method checks if the modifier has been expired due to its CardCostModifierArg.EXPIRATION_TRIGGER. For a OneTurnCostModifier, the expiration trigger is assumed to be a TurnEndTrigger.

        Then, the modifier evaluates its CardCostModifierArg.TARGET and CardCostModifierArg.FILTER and sees if the card is equal to or is contained within the resulting set of Entity objects. When not specified, the CardCostModifierArg.TARGET is assumed to be the EntityReference.FRIENDLY_HAND.

        The CardCostModifierArg.RACE argument, if specified, is compared to the card instance's Card.getRace().

        The CardCostModifierArg.CARD_TYPE argument, if specified, is compared to the card instance's Card.getCardType().

        Finally, the CardCostModifierArg.TARGET_PLAYER argument, if specified, is compared to the card instance's getOwner() with respect to the getHostReference() of this modifier. For example, if CardCostModifierArg.TARGET_PLAYER is TargetPlayer.SELF, then the card's Entity.getOwner() is compared to the getHostReference() Entity.getOwner().

        Parameters:
        context - The game context.
        card - The card to evaluate.
        player - The player from whose point of view this should be evaluated.
        Returns:
        true if the modifier applies to this card.

      • canFire

        public boolean canFire(GameEvent event)
        Card cost modifiers can always fire with respect to a given event (they are refreshed by all events).
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getOwner

        public int getOwner()
        The player that originally created the card cost modifier, regardless if this modifier is being hosted by a Player entity.
        Specified by:
        getOwner in interface Trigger
        Returns:
        The original creator (caster) of the modifier.

      • getTargetPlayer

        public TargetPlayer getTargetPlayer()
        Gets the target player of the given card cost modifier.

        This is relative to the owner of the modifier, which is typically the caster, not the owner of the getHostReference().

        Returns:
        TargetPlayer.SELF if not specified, otherwise the TargetPlayer specified by the modifier.

      • interestedIn

        public boolean interestedIn(GameEventType eventType)
        Description copied from interface: Trigger
        Returns true if this trigger is a listener for the given GameEventType.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        eventType - The event type.
        Returns:
        true if this trigger wants its Trigger.onGameEvent(GameEvent) method called whenever it Trigger.canFire(GameEvent) to the specified eventType.

      • hasPersistentOwner

        public boolean hasPersistentOwner()
        Description copied from interface: Trigger
        Indicates this trigger cannot change owners. For example, a Secret does not have a persistent owner, because card texts can steal secrets. However, the trigger described by Blessing of Wisdom does have a persistent owner, since the casting player of that spell should always draw the card it receives.
        Specified by:
        hasPersistentOwner in interface Trigger
        Returns:
        true if the trigger's Trigger.onGameEvent(GameEvent) should be evaluated from the point of view of the owner when the trigger was created, as opposed to what the owner is right now (which may have changed).

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        true if this is a one-turn long trigger.
